notes: Fifth generation 996.2 facelift with revised front styling (Turbo-look headlights). RWD or AWD (Carrera 4). Targa variant features retractable glass roof. Tiptronic S automatic transmission. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche 911 (996) article, January 2025 revision.

Fifth generation 996 Turbo with variable turbine geometry (VTG) turbochargers. AWD standard. X50 power kit increases output to 450 hp (Turbo S). Complex turbo boost control requires specialized diagnostics. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche 911 (996) article, January 2025 revision.

Track-focused 996 GT3 with naturally aspirated flat-6. Manual transmission only. RWD with race-derived suspension geometry requiring specialized alignment procedures. Large rear wing for downforce. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche 911 (996) article, January 2025 revision.

Sixth generation 997 with revised styling addressing 996 criticism. RWD or AWD (Carrera 4). Targa variant features retractable glass roof panel. Tiptronic S automatic or manual. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche 911 (997) article, January 2025 revision.

Sixth generation 997 Turbo with variable turbine geometry turbochargers. AWD standard. Turbo S variant produces 530 hp. Complex boost control requires specialized diagnostics. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche 911 (997) article, January 2025 revision.

Track-focused 997 GT3 with naturally aspirated flat-6. Manual transmission only. RWD with race-derived suspension. GT3 RS variant produces 435 hp with additional weight reduction. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche 911 (997) article, January 2025 revision.

First generation 986 Boxster facelift with revised styling and increased engine displacement. Mid-engine RWD roadster. Convertible soft top mechanism requires specialized service procedures. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Boxster article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation 987 Boxster with new platform and styling. Mid-engine RWD. Convertible soft top mechanism requires specialized service. Shares platform with 987 Cayman. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Boxster article, January 2025 revision.

First generation 987 Cayman fixed-roof coupe introduced as Boxster counterpart. Mid-engine RWD. Shares platform and engines with 987 Boxster. Named after Caiman alligator. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Cayman article, January 2025 revision.

First generation E1 Cayenne marked Porsche's entry into SUV market. Built on VW Group PL71 platform (shared with VW Touareg, Audi Q7). Manual transmission available on base V6 (rare). AWD with low-range transfer case. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Cayenne article, January 2025 revision.

First generation E1 Cayenne facelift with updated styling and increased displacements. Turbo S variant produces 550 hp. Manual transmission still available on base model. AWD with Porsche Traction Management. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Cayenne article, January 2025 revision.

Limited production mid-engine supercar. 5.7L V10 derived from Le Mans racing program. Carbon fiber monocoque chassis, ceramic composite clutch (PCCC), manual transmission only. 1,270 units produced. Requires specialized expertise for service due to exotic materials and racing-derived components. Data sourced from Wikipedia Porsche Carrera GT article, January 2025 revision.
